Chicken Curry

Kerri -

So, as you can imagine, a 2 kilo chicken generates rather a lot of leftovers. I’m not great with chicken leftovers, they scream PIE to me and unfortunately, that doesn’t fit with our current efforts to eat healthily. Admittedly, a chicken curry doesn’t automatically scream HEALTH but Stephen found a Good Food recipe that was […]

Isaacs Skylander Cake For His Birthday Party This Is A 2 Layer Chocolate Cake Filled With Chocolate Butter Cream Frosting The Sides And

Isaac's Skylander cake for his birthday party. This is a 2 layer chocolate cake filled with chocolate butter cream frosting. The sides and Skylander decals are all marshmallow fondant. Such a fun cake to do!

Help with videos

Streaming media

Websites in the Fairfax Digital Network offer streaming video and audio in the Flash format. Streaming media allows you to watch video on a website as a continuous feed, as opposed to waiting for an entire audio or video file to download to your computer before you can use it.

Download the software

To play a video or multimedia clip, you need to have the Flash player installed. You can download one for most systems (including Mac OS X) for free if one is not already installed on your system.

Which Speed?

Our automated system will test your connection speed and send the best video stream so it plays smoothly and continuously.

Alternatively, you can manually choose the speed setting that corresponds most closely with your network connection. We produce clips in a range of speeds to deliver the best quality possible-- the better the quality the faster connection you'll need.

Magazine Archives: Jan. 31, 2012 - Feb. 29, 2012

Robert Lawrence Balzer: 1912-2011

James Laube
Issue: February 29, 2012

Robert Lawrence Balzer became America's first wine journalist, an unabashed cheerleader for California wine as the industry matured, and one of the country's preeminent wine educators. Balzer died Dec. 2 at the age of 99 at his home in Orange, Calif. Wine Spectator's James Laube reports.

For the full article, check out the new issue of Wine Spectator, on newsstands January 31, 2012.

Hot Dog Mike feeds the crowd at First Thursday in Hillcrest.

Hot Dog Mike, having apparently settled the family matters that prompted his departure from Little Rock, is coming back to Arkansas.

Mooyah Burgers shakes up the Indy restaurant scene

This is an archived article and the information in the article may be outdated. Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.

(September, 01, 2015) - Mooyah! There's another burger joint stepping into the ring of burger wars. The restaurant offers several types of burgers, some sweet and salty fries to shake things up. Sherman is there to get a taste of what they're serving.

Magazine Archives: May 15, 2004

Michelin Names France's New Three Stars

Nick Fauchald
Issue: May 15, 2004

Travelers headed to France this year may want to revise their list of dining spots to visit. Three restaurants were awarded a coveted third star in the 2004 Michelin Red Guide to France, the gastronomic guidebook known for launching chefs' careers.

For the full article, check out the new issue of Wine Spectator, on newsstands May 15, 2004.

La Comida de los Cocineros

Season 2 Episode 216 | 6m 28s Video has closed captioning.

Before leaving Mexico for North Carolina, Oscar didn’t know how to flip a tortilla on the grill. Now, under the direction of a James Beard award-winning chef, he and fellow cooks Javier, Romeo and Ramiro run the line at the high-end Lantern Restaurant in Chapel Hill. The cocineros have adapted to life in a new country by leaning on each other in the kitchen—both at work and at home.

Aired: 06/29/17

Expired: 06/28/20

Rating: NR

Problems Playing Video? | Closed Captioning

Albert Adrià: The Magician of the Moment

El Bulli's secret weapon is a secret no longer

Call him biased if you like, but when the man widely considered to be the world's best chef tells you who really deserves the title, you pay attention. "The best cook I've ever come across," says Ferran Adrià, "is my brother Albert."

For most of his career, Albert Adrià labored leeward of Ferran. Although Albert joined the staff at elBulli--the now closed restaurant on the coast of Catalonia renowned for avant-garde cuisine--a mere year after his brother started and stayed until 2009, the younger brother never achieved the fame of the outspoken Ferran. Yet it was he who developed many of...

December 2005
Consolidation and the Future of Small, Premium Wineries
High-end wines will find success, not through brand or varietal marketing, but though "typifying" wines based on style, origin and characters that are recognizable to consumers.
by Agustin Huneeus
This Insight & Opinion is based on the keynote address presented at the MKF Research 2005 Executive Wine Summit by Agustin Huneeus, proprietor of Quintessa, former chairman and president of Franciscan Estates, former head of Seagram's worldwide wine operations and former CEO of Concha y Toro. This year's summit, held June 7-8 in Yountville, CA, brought top-level executives of the wine industry together to focus on the most pressing issues facing the industry, including new industry rules, ho...

Somewhere South

Dumpling Dilemma

Passport 04/10/2020 | 52m 41s Video has closed captioning.

A charity dinner and a trip to the Mississippi Delta and farther south reminds Vivian that not all dumplings are the same. But whether filled with minced meat, chopped veggies, or nothing at all, dumplings stretch our ingredients and our imagination.

Aired: 04/10/20

Expires: 04/23/23

Rating: TV-G

How to Choose the Best Turkey Breed

Choosing the Best Turkey Breed

Many turkey breeds are available to choose from. Although turkeys are typically considered to be primarily meat birds, some of the heritage varieties have become popular in the showroom. In selecting the best breed for your particular situation, consider three basic criteria. Size Matters A dressed turkey must conveniently fit into your refrigerator while it […]
